header.sendDiagnosticsText: Device Simulation can send anonymous information to Microsoft, such as error logs, configuration, and information about how you use the application. No personal information is collected.

simulation.name: Name
simulation.vieIotHubMetrics: View IoT Hub metrics in the Azure portal

details.missingChart: IoT Hub metrics unavaliable. Metrics charts are only supported for simulations using the default hub deployed with Device Simulation.
details.insufficientPermissions: IoT Hub metrics unavailable. Device Simulation needs additional permissions to access IoT Hub metrics.

deviceModels.description: Choose type of device to simulate.
deviceModels.name: Name

duration.description: Set how long the simulation will run.

form.deleteDevicesWhenSimulationEnds: Delete all devices when the simulation is complete

errorMsg.duplicateModelsNotAllowed: A device model may be used only once
errorMsg.nameGTMaxLength: Name can't be greater than {{simulationNameMaxLength}} characters
errorMsg.descGTMaxLength: Description can't be greater than {{simulationDescMaxLength}} characters
errorMsg.deviceModelIsRequired: A device model must be selected
errorMsg.valueLTMinDuration: Duration must be at least {{minimumDurationInMinutes}} minutes
errorMsg.countCantBeLessThanZero: Amount must be no less than zero
errorMsg.countShouldBeLTMax: Total number of devices must be no greater than {{maxSimulatedDevices}}
errorMsg.frequencyCantBeLessThanMinTelemetryInter: Telemetry frequency must be no less than {{ interval }} seconds
errorMsg.countShouldBeGTZero: Number of devices must be greater than zero
errorMsg.hubNameCantBeEmpty: IoT Hub connection string is required
errorMsg.simulationStatusError: Something went wrong and we weren't able to get the simulation status.
errorMsg.invalidHubUnits: Hub units should be between 1 and 10

form.autoScaleAcknowledgement: I understand simulating {{ totalDevicesCount }} devices requires {{ additionVMsCount }} additional VMs to be deployed in my Azure subscription. These VMs will be automatically removed once all simulations are stopped.

targetHub.description: Add the connection string for your IoT Hub

sku.description: Specify the IoT Hub throttling limits to use for this simulation.
sku.warningMessage: This simulation will be throttled at {{ messageThrottlingLimit }} messages per second with these settings.

tooltip.bulkDeletion: Automatically bulk deletes your devices when your simulation completes, so you don’t have to delete them one by one. If you want to keep your devices so you can run the simulation again, leave this option unchecked.

delete.title: Delete
delete.description: Are you sure you want to delete

status.metircsNotAvailable: Hub metrics not available for simulations with non-default hub
status.simulationRunning: Your simulation is running. Please allow a few minutes before you see data flowing to your IoT Hub.

delete.title: Delete
delete.description: Are you sure you want to delete

new.title: Add Device Model
new.basicDeviceModelDescription: Define a new simulated device and the telemetry data to be sent from the device to your IoT hub. A single device can send one or more data points (e.g. location, humidity, etc.) allowing you to simulate data coming from real devices.
new.name: Device model name
new.telemetryDescription: Set parameters for telemetry sent for the sensor.
new.dataDescription: Set parameters for telemetry sent for the data point

upload.deviceModelInfoText:
Each simulated device is derived from a specific device model. Device models define the device
's capabilities and behavior including what messages to send, which methods are supported, etc.
upload.deviceModelFilesInfoText: Device models consist of one JSON configuration file, one JavaScript file defining the simulation behavior, and optionally one JavaScript file for each cloud to device method supported by the device. Advanced device models give you full control over these files.
upload.missingJsonFileErrorMessage: No JSON definition file was found. The JSON file defines the device's capabilities and is required.
upload.tooManyJsonFilesErrorMessage: More than one JSON file provided. A simulated device may have only one JSON definition file.
upload.missingJSFileErrorMessage: {{missingScriptNamesString}} file(s) are missing. Please add these files

errorMsg.nameGTMaxLength: Name can't be greater than {{formFieldMaxLength}} characters
errorMsg.dataPointGTMaxLength: Data point can't be greater than {{formFieldMaxLength}} characters
errorMsg.versionGTMaxLength: Version can't be greater than {{formFieldMaxLength}} characters
errorMsg.descGTMaxLength: Description can't be greater than {{formDescMaxLength}} characters
errorMsg.unitGTMaxLength: Unit can't be greater than {{formDescMaxLength}} characters
errorMsg.nameCantBeDuplicate: Device model name already been used
errorMsg.intervalCantBeLessThanOneSecond: Telemetry interval must be no less than 1 seconds
errorMsg.frequencyCantBeLessThanMinTelemetryInter: Telemetry frequency must be no less than {{ interval }} seconds
errorMsg.minValueMustBeLessThanMax: Min value must be less than the max value
errorMsg.maxValueMustBeGreaterThanMin: Max value must be greater than the min value

getStarted.title: Get started
getStarted.description: Build basic or advanced simulated devices that look and act like the real thing. Gather, process, analyze, act on data, and use it for end-to-end solution testing. Choose from the following if you'd like help getting started.

sampleSimulation.title: Sample simulation
sampleSimulation.description: Get started instantly using a sample simulation. With the sample simulation you can see data flowing to your IoT Hub right away. This will simulate a few trucks sending location, speed and cargo temperature data.

sampleDevices.title: Sample devices
sampleDevices.description: Get started quickly creating a simulation using sample devices. With a simple simulation using sample devices you can see data flowing to your IoT Hub right away. Simulate sample trucks, elevators, chillers and more.

customDevices.title: Custom devices
customDevices.description: Custom devices allow you to specify exactly what data is sent to your IoT Hub. You can define the different data points to send (e.g. temperature, fuel level, etc.) and provide value ranges to represent data from physical devices.

advancedDevices.title: Advanced devices
advancedDevices.description: Design complex device behaviors by authoring a custom JSON device definition file and scripting device behaviors in JavaScript. The advanced device experience gives you full control over how your simulated devices behave.

getStarted.findMe: You can always find this on the help menu
